subtitleNullable: A dataset of faces from the GochiUsa anime
descriptionNullable:
edit: [2022-05-14] Update the dataset. It is now divided in four sets (ANIME, MANGA, DANBOORU & OFFICIAL_ILLUSTRATIONS). Each set has two versions: one with 9 main characters and a secondary version for characters with less samples. 32 samples of each major character is presented in the .pdf for each set. A notebook is provided for exploring the dataset and minimal use case example (categorization task).
DOI: 10.34740/kaggle/dsv/3626236
____________________________

We introduce the GochiUsa\_Faces dataset, building a dataset of almost 40k picture of faces from nine characters. The resolution range from 26x26 to 987x987 with 356x356 being the median resolution. 

We also provide two supplementary datasets: a test set of independent drawings and an additional face dataset for nine minor characters.

Some experiments show the subject on which GochiUsa\_Faces could serve as a toy dataset. They include categorization, data compression and conditional generation.

For datailed information on how this dataset was created, as well as example of applications, [check this pdf](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1wdj_LkVktc3qYKh8v1zXFNSdTxfLa2Uq).
title: GochiUsa_Faces
subtitle: A dataset of faces from the GochiUsa anime
description:
edit: [2022-05-14] Update the dataset. It is now divided in four sets (ANIME, MANGA, DANBOORU & OFFICIAL_ILLUSTRATIONS). Each set has two versions: one with 9 main characters and a secondary version for characters with less samples. 32 samples of each major character is presented in the .pdf for each set. A notebook is provided for exploring the dataset and minimal use case example (categorization task).
DOI: 10.34740/kaggle/dsv/3626236
____________________________

We introduce the GochiUsa\_Faces dataset, building a dataset of almost 40k picture of faces from nine characters. The resolution range from 26x26 to 987x987 with 356x356 being the median resolution. 

We also provide two supplementary datasets: a test set of independent drawings and an additional face dataset for nine minor characters.

Some experiments show the subject on which GochiUsa\_Faces could serve as a toy dataset. They include categorization, data compression and conditional generation.

For datailed information on how this dataset was created, as well as example of applications, [check this pdf](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1wdj_LkVktc3qYKh8v1zXFNSdTxfLa2Uq).
